Package ohos.media.audio

Class AudioManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.audio.AudioManager

  • public class AudioManager
extends Object
    Manages audio information, controls audio devices, adjusts the volume, and manages the audio focus.

    An AudioManager instance adjusts the global volume, mutes streams, controls the audio version, sets the ringer mode (sound, silent, or vibration), and enables or disables audio devices.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#AUDIO

      • setVolume

        public boolean setVolume​(AudioManager.AudioVolumeType volumeType,
                         int volume)
        Sets the volume level of a specified type of streams.
        Parameters:
        volumeType - Indicates the type of streams for which the volume level is to set.
        volume - Indicates the volume level to set. You can obtain the maximum level value by calling getMaxVolume(ohos.media.audio.AudioManager.AudioVolumeType), and the minimum by getMinVolume(ohos.media.audio.AudioManager.AudioVolumeType).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getMaxVolume(AudioVolumeType), getMinVolume(AudioVolumeType), getVolume(AudioVolumeType)

      • getVolume

        public int getVolume​(AudioManager.AudioVolumeType volumeType)
              throws AudioRemoteException
        Obtains the volume level of a specified type of audio streams.
        Parameters:
        volumeType - Indicates the stream type.
        Returns:
        Returns the volume level of the type of streams.
        Throws:
        AudioRemoteException - Throws this exception if the volume level fails to be obtained.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getMaxVolume(AudioVolumeType), getMinVolume(AudioVolumeType), setVolume(AudioVolumeType, int)

      • setRingerMode

        public boolean setRingerMode​(AudioManager.AudioRingMode mode)
        Sets the ringer mode.

        In silent mode, a device is silent and does not vibrate. In vibration mode, a device is silent and vibrates. In sound mode, a device is audible and may vibrate (depending on user settings).

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the ringer mode, which can be AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_NORMAL, AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_SILENT, or AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getRingerMode()

      • getRingerMode

        public int getRingerMode​()
                  throws AudioRemoteException
        Obtains the ringer mode.
        Returns:
        Returns the ringer mode, which can be AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_NORMAL, AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_SILENT, or AudioRingMode#RINGER_MODE_VIBRATE.
        Throws:
        AudioRemoteException - Throws this exception if the ringer mode fails to be obtained.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        setRingerMode(AudioRingMode)

        public boolean setDeviceActive​(int deviceType,
                               boolean state)
        Turns on or off a device.
        Parameters:
        deviceType - Indicates the device type, which can be DEVICE_ID_SPEAKERPHONE or DEVICE_ID_BLUETOOTH.
        state - Indicates the turn-on or turn-off state.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

                       throws AudioRemoteException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns true if the device is turned on; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        AudioRemoteException - Throws this exception if the device state fails to be obtained.
        Since:
        3

      • activateAudioInterrupt

        public boolean activateAudioInterrupt​(AudioInterrupt interrupt)
        Activates audio interruption.

        Before playing audio, an application sends an interruption request to other applications for pausing audio playback or decreasing the volume, preventing audio conflicts.

        Parameters:
        interrupt - Indicates the interruption data structure, including interruption information and the interruption listener.
        Returns:
        Returns true if audio interruption is activated; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        deactivateAudioInterrupt(AudioInterrupt), AudioInterrupt

      • deactivateAudioInterrupt

        public boolean deactivateAudioInterrupt​(AudioInterrupt interrupt)
        Deactivates audio interruption.

        If an application does not need to receive interruption messages, call this method to deactivate audio interruption for the application.

        Parameters:
        interrupt - Indicates the interruption data structure, including interruption information and the interruption listener.
        Returns:
        Returns true if audio interruption is deactivated; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        activateAudioInterrupt(AudioInterrupt), AudioInterrupt

        public boolean setAudioParameter​(String key,
                                 String value)
        Sets values of a variable number of parameters for audio devices.
        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the key of parameters to be set.
        value - Indicates the value of parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

        public String getAudioParameter​(String key)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • registerAudioCapturerCallback

        public void registerAudioCapturerCallback​(AudioCapturerCallback cb)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Registers a callback to receive notifications about capturer configuration changes.
        Parameters:
        cb - Indicates the non-null callback to register.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if cb is null.
        Since:
        1

      • registerAudioRendererCallback

        public void registerAudioRendererCallback​(AudioRendererCallback cb)
        Registers an audio playback callback for the current device. When the playback status or a playback parameter changes, this callback will notify your application of the change.
        Parameters:
        cb - Indicates the audio playback callback. You need to implement this callback in your application.
        Since:
        3

      • setAudioDeviceChangeObserver

        public void setAudioDeviceChangeObserver​(AudioDeviceChangeObserver observer)
        Sets an observer to listen for state changes of an audio device, for example, when it becomes connected or disconnected.

        You can call this method to obtain the device changes in a timely manner.

        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        Since:
        4

      • unregisterAudioCapturerCallback

        public void unregisterAudioCapturerCallback​(AudioCapturerCallback cb)
        Unregisters the callback that has been registered with registerAudioCapturerCallback(ohos.media.audio.AudioCapturerCallback).
        Parameters:
        cb - Indicates the non-null callback to unregister.
        Since:
        1

      • unregisterAudioRendererCallback

        public void unregisterAudioRendererCallback​(AudioRendererCallback cb)
        Deregisters an audio playback callback listening the current device. After the deregistration, your application will not be notified when the audio playback status or a playback parameter changes.
        Parameters:
        cb - Indicates the audio playback callback, which has been registered by registerAudioRendererCallback(ohos.media.audio.AudioRendererCallback).
        Since:
        3

      • getActiveCapturerConfigs

        public List<AudioCapturerConfig> getActiveCapturerConfigs​()
        Obtains currently active capturer configurations of the device.
        Returns:
        Returns the non-null list of capturer configurations if any is active; returns an empty list otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getActiveRendererConfigs

        Returns:
        Returns the audio stream information.
        Since:
        3

      • getDevices

        public static AudioDeviceDescriptor[] getDevices​(AudioDeviceDescriptor.DeviceFlag flag)
        Obtains information about audio input or output devices, or that about all audio devices.
        Parameters:
        flag - Indicates input or output devices, or all audio devices.
        Returns:
        Returns an array with the same information structure as an AudioDeviceDescriptor instance if the information is obtained; returns an array whose length is 0 otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setMasterMute

        public boolean setMasterMute​(boolean isMute)
        Mutes or unmutes global audio streams.
        Parameters:
        isMute - Indicates whether to mute global audio streams. Value true means global audio streams will be muted, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setMicrophoneMute

        public boolean setMicrophoneMute​(boolean isMute)
        Mutes or unmutes a microphone.
        Parameters:
        isMute - Indicates whether to mute a microphone. Value true means that the microphone will be muted, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • changeVolumeBy

        public boolean changeVolumeBy​(AudioManager.AudioVolumeType volumeType,
                              int index)
        Increases or decreases the current volume by a certain amount.

        If the target stream volume exceeds the maximum or is lower than the minimum allowed, the volume will be set to the maximum or minimum volume.

        Parameters:
        volumeType - Indicates the audio stream type.
        index - Indicates the volume change relative to the original volume. The value can be -1, 0, or 1. Value 1 indicates that the volume is increased by one level, -1 indicates that the volume is decreased by one level, and 0 indicates that the volume remains unchanged.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the volume is changed; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getMasterOutputSampleRate

        public static int getMasterOutputSampleRate​()
        Obtains the sampling rate of the master output device. The sampling rate can be used as a reference for audio playback.
        Returns:
        Returns the sampling rate.
        Since:
        3

      • getMasterOutputFrameCount

        public static int getMasterOutputFrameCount​()
        Obtains the number of frames in the buffer of the master output device. The value can be used as a reference for audio playback.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of frames.
        Since:
        3

      • isStreamActive

        public static boolean isStreamActive​(AudioManager.AudioVolumeType volumeType)
        Checks whether audio streams of a specified type are active.
        Parameters:
        volumeType - Indicates the audio stream type.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified audio streams are active; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • connectBluetoothSco

        public boolean connectBluetoothSco​()
        Connects to the Bluetooth SCO channel.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the connection is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • disconnectBluetoothSco

        public boolean disconnectBluetoothSco​()
        Disconnects from the Bluetooth SCO channel.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the disconnection is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:

      • makeSessionId

        public static int makeSessionId​()
        Creates a session ID to be used by AudioRendererInfo.Builder#sessionID(int) for setting audio playback parameters and AudioCapturerInfo.Builder#sessionID(int) for setting recording parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns the session ID if created; returns -1 otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isMasterMute

        public boolean isMasterMute​()
                     throws AudioRemoteException
        Checks whether audio streams are muted globally.
        Returns:
        Returns true if all audio streams are muted; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        AudioRemoteException - Throws this exception if the check fails.
        Since:
        3
